summary: A versatile full-stack developer with a strong record of building impactful software products. Proven ability to translate technical challenges into innovative product solutions across all stages of the development lifecycle.

education.subject: Cond. Matter Physics
departments: Centre for Science at Extreme Conditions
Year abroad: Uni. of Auckland, NZ

experience.summary: Cydar is a medical imaging startup that creates real-time 3D deformation models of the heart from CT scans, overlaying them onto X-ray video streams to guide surgical procedures.

notes.note: Delivered new surgical planning software with AI-powered analytical tools, facilitating faster clinical decision-making.
Managed frontend codebase development, introducing new coding standards to optimize the SDLC and ensure HIPAA compliance.
Implemented a new CI pipeline with automated integration tests, cutting server costs and doubling run time efficiency.
Contributed significantly to the development of a benchmarking tool for algorithmic ROI identification in CT scans, enabling faster real-time updates during live surgeries.
Streamlined the software release cycle by developing a GitHub-Slackbot tool that notified developers of PR merge conflicts from upstream changes, reducing bottlenecks in the QA queue.
Enhanced backend services with improved image sorting algorithm to ensure correct CT stacking order, fortifying the value of the main user portal as a tool to browse CT scans.

Rewrote the legacy codebase for the surgical guidance app using a modern component-based framework, evaluating the existing code, creating an iterative roadmap, and implementing tests to produce a type-safe, extensible codebase. Enabled efficient development of new customer-requested features.
Quickly triaged and remotely resolved critical bugs reported by clinical users, minimizing downtime and contributing to a 100% user retention rate.

experience.summary: Scott Logic is a respected software consultancy, providing formal training and contributing to the development of scalable, enterprise-level codebases within a large team.

notes.note: Engineered a scalable Single Sign-On (SSO) service for the Scottish Government, implementing PKCE authentication and meeting strict OAuth 2.0 security standards, ensuring GDPR compliance.
Delivered formal CI/CD training to graduates, enabling them to automate builds and deployments with infrastructure as code, enhancing their value to the company.
Developed a proof of concept for the SSO authorization server, evaluating various programming frameworks to identify the most secure and efficient platform for the final product.
Fostered teamwork and collaboration while working with a diverse group of graduates on an internal project, improving communication and project outcomes.
Mentored PhD students within a reputable high-pressure science research group, supporting their research goals.
Planned and led multi-day experiential campaigns, collecting data at international facilities with specialized instrumentation.
First author on research papers published in high-impact journals.
Honed public speaking skills by delivering presentations to large audiences at international conferences.

projects.name: Portfolio site
projects.description: Developed a personal portfolio using a modern JavaScript framework to showcase coding projects and personal interests. Implemented Server-Side Rendering (SSR) and integrated interactive features, including a mini 2D physics engine and a library for drawing complex shapes on the HTML canvas.

projects.name: In Theatre GUI - Cydar Medical
projects.description: Rebuilt the frontend of a real-time surgical guidance application, implementing a new UX design with Svelte to replace a legacy JavaScript solution. Gained a deep understanding of the existing application, which used Redux for state management and WebSockets for communication with cloud-based GPU servers. A key challenge was integrating the Redux store with Svelte to allow components to subscribe to state changes. Rebuilt the product from the ground up, resulting in a highly extensible, maintainable, and testable codebase. The application is now used by surgeons in critical operations to improve patient outcomes.

projects.name: Browser based D&D Initiative Tracker
projects.description: Created an app to assist with managing Dungeons & Dragons games, as part of a broader tool suite I'm actively building. The app features a static yet feature-rich design, with data persistence via local storage, a visual action log, and an intuitive, user-friendly interface.

projects.name: Free Website with CMS
projects.description: Built a cost-effective website for a small dance company in Uganda, featuring a simple system for managing content and updating the timetable, designed for users with minimal computer literacy. The site is hosted on GitHub Pages and uses Netlify for user-authenticated content management.

projects.name: Spotify CLI
projects.description: Bash scripted Command-line Interface, leveraging the Spotify Dev API to play and manage songs and playlists.

projects.name: Full-Stack Wedding App
projects.description: Built an app on the MERN stack to manage wedding logistics. Deployed as microservices with a focus on security. A reverse proxy orchestrates traffic, while the backend authentication server validates users and manages sessions via cookies. The app allows guests to manage meal choices, report arrival times, find seating, and access the itinerary – "Wapp" effectively streamlined our wedding organization.

projects.name: Wizard Grenade 2D Game
projects.description: Developed my first major project to learn Object-Oriented Programming and design patterns. Built a fully functional local multiplayer game from scratch, creating an extensible game library with a custom physics engine, featuring original artwork and music.

publications.title: Structural phase transitions in yttrium up to 183 GPa
Intense Reactivity in Sulfur-Hydrogen Mixtures at High Pressure under X-ray Irradiation
publications.journal: The Journal of Physical Chemistry Letters

publications.title: Synthesis and stability of hydrogen selenide compounds at high pressure
